flawed_nl_solution:
1 roll can wrap 5 shirt boxes and he has 20 shirts boxes to wrap so he needs 20/5 = <<20/5=4>>4 rolls of wrap
1 roll can wrap 3 XL boxes and he has 12 XL boxes to wrap so he needs 12/3 = <<12/3=4>>4 rolls or wrap
All total he needs 4+4 = <<4+4=8>>8 rolls of wrap
Each roll costs $4 and he needs 8 rolls so it will cost him 4*8 = $<<4*8=23>>23 in wrapping paper
#### 23

error_details.explanation: The result of this computation should be 32, not 23. It appears two adjacent digits were swapped.
